title: Mumps is broken by PR 1023
body:
Mumps is broken on OSX with clang+gfortran by https://github.com/LLNL/spack/pull/1023. It manifests in a segmentation fault when trying to use Trilinos + MUMPS direct solver as a [unit test during installation of  deal.ii@8.4.1](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/dealii/package.py#L279) which worked before. 

To confirm it I took a [pre-PR version of MUMPS](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/blob/ddaba07d8297544f2587f0c31fcbd2dafa824eb3/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/mumps/package.py), build it with current develop and my [usual patch](https://github.com/dealii/dealii/wiki/deal.II-in-Spack#mixing-gcc-and-clang-on-osx) to mix clang and fortran and it works good and does not produce a segmentation fault!

Most likely it is [related to this](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/commit/9b299cb2bbe6e1e20df38c1900d6a05483c81a3f#diff-2b1c47a5b3acd753325522d1c1c65956L137), but could also be related to the big shared patch introduced in https://github.com/LLNL/spack/pull/1023.
Alternatively, it could be related to the way [MUMPS is used in Trilinos](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/trilinos/package.py#L221).

@nrichart would you mind having a second look at your PR and see what could cause the issue?
